node.title: Man who allegedly set ex-partner on fire likely used accelerant, court told
node.description: Medical experts have given evidence in the attempted murder trial of a man who allegedly set his partner alight, saying the pattern of her burnsÂ indicates an accelerant was used.
node.content:
["A burns specialist, giving evidence in the attempted murder trial of a man accused of setting his partner alight, has told the jury the victim's burn pattern indicates an accelerant was applied to her left-hand side.", "The trial, which is now in its fifth week, is hearing evidence from the medical experts who treated a then 20-year-old woman who was allegedly set on fire by her 39-year-old partner in a shed on a Chigwell property in Tasmania in 2017.", "The parties cannot be named for legal reasons.", "The Crown and defence agree the relationship was \"volatile\" \u2014\u00a0with violence on both sides \u2014 and on that night in April 2017, the pair got into a physical and verbal fight.", "What happened next is where the\u00a0two cases differ.", "The Crown alleges that while in the shed the man poured petrol on her and later flicked a lighter in her direction.", "The defence has introduced evidence that the woman suffered from suicidal ideations and has asked the jury to consider whether it was in fact\u00a0a tragic accident \u2014\u00a0the \"actions of a highly emotional disturbed young woman making suicide threats that went wrong\".", "
Emergency doctor details 'very, very severe burns'
", "In court today, medical experts have described the severity of her burns.", "Royal Hobart Hospital emergency department doctor John Dewing told the court he remembered the victim \"moaning in pain\", when she arrived.", "He said it was initially estimated about 60 per cent of her body was severely burnt. Post surgery, that was later revised to 55 per cent.", "Dr Dewing said the \"other immediate concern\" was evidence of burns to her face, throat and upper airway, which could \"rapidly progress to breathing problems and obstruct airways\".", "\"[She was a] critically ill patient with very, very severe burns,\" he said.", "\"We were looking at short-term life threats that needed urgent treatment.\"", "The woman was sedated, intubated to help her breathe and prepped for emergency surgery.", "In surgery, she was treated by burns director Dr Andrew Castley \u2014 in court today, he took the jury through photos of the woman, describing the full extent of her injuries.", "\"Any burn over 20 per cent is a significant burn \u2026 [a] very serious burn\u00a0is anything over 50\u00a0per cent,\" he said.", "\"The vast majority [of the time it] means there's accelerant involved.\"", "The court heard the woman had burns to her arms and legs, chest, lower back, buttocks, abdomen, as well as the front of her neck and around her chin.", "Dr Castley said it was most likely accelerant had been applied to her left side, but it was difficult to say where the flame was introduced.", "He told the court the woman's burns were so severe\u00a0she had to be\u00a0flown to Melbourne for treatment.", "The trial continues."]
